business_rules: Always validate root cause from at least two independent data sources (shipment logs + carrier performance).
Never recommend cancelling shipments unless explicitly supported by data.
Always provide at least one mitigation action and one process improvement recommendation.
Recommendations must be realistic within standard logistics SLAs (<=72 hours ETA).
Maintain neutrality when identifying causes — do not assign blame to a specific vendor, carrier, or location without verified multi-source evidence.
Avoid biased or discriminatory language towards any supplier, carrier, region, or workforce group.
Ensure fairness in recommendations by considering all carriers and vendors equally based on performance metrics and factual data.
If data is incomplete or ambiguous, clearly indicate uncertainty instead of making assumptions.
Use objective, data-backed language — replace blame-oriented statements with neutral phrasing such as 'Root cause likely due to...' instead of 'Vendor caused...'.
All decisions and recommendations must be explainable with supporting data references for audit transparency.
